00009 // constructor of the matrixInt...:
00010 matrixInt::matrixInt(int dimension1, int dimension2)
00011 {
00012    createAndInitialize(dimension1,dimension2);
00013 }
00014 
00015 // copy operator... this does nothing special, but i just like to make explicit
00016 // that this does _NOT_ allocate new memory for a new array...:
00017 matrixInt::matrixInt(matrixInt& orig)
00018 {
00019    dim1 = orig.dim1;
00020    dim2 = orig.dim2;
00021    thematrix = orig.thematrix;  // do not copy the array, just the pointer...
00022 }
00023 
00024 
00025 // destructor of the matrixInt...:
00026 matrixInt::~matrixInt()
00027 {
00028    for (int i=0; i<dim1; ++i)
00029       delete thematrix[i];
00030    delete thematrix; 
00031 }
00032 
00033 // This function creates a 2 dimensional integer matrixInt[dim1][dim2] at run time
00034 // and initializes it to zero.
00035 void matrixInt::createAndInitialize(int dimension1, int dimension2)
00036 {
00037    dim1 = dimension1;
00038    dim2 = dimension2;
00039    thematrix = new (int *[dim1]);
00040    for (int i=0; i<dim1; ++i)
00041    {
00042       int *subarray = new int[dim2];
00043       for (int j=0; j<dim2; ++j)
00044      subarray[j] = 0;   // initialize the matrix to null.
00045       thematrix[i] = subarray;
00046    }
00047 }
00048 
00049 
00050 // exchange two rows in the matrix:
00051 matrixInt& matrixInt::exchangeRows(int a, int b)
00052 {
00053    int *tmpRow  = thematrix[a];
00054    thematrix[a] = thematrix[b];
00055    thematrix[b] = tmpRow;
00056    return *this;
00057 }
00058 
00059 // exchange two columns in the matrix:
00060 matrixInt& matrixInt::exchangeColumns(int a, int b)
00061 {
00062    int i = 0;
00063    while (i < dim1)
00064    {
00065       int *thisRow = thematrix[i++];
00066       int tmp    = thisRow[a];
00067       thisRow[a] = thisRow[b];
00068       thisRow[b] = tmp;
00069    }
00070    return *this;
00071 }
00072 
00073 
00074 // Print the matrix, if \(transp != NIL\) exchange x and y coordinates.
00075 void matrixInt::print(Transposition transp)
00076 {
00077    int vertical = transp==Transposed ? dim2 : dim1;
00078    int horizontal = transp==Transposed ? dim1 : dim2;
00079    for (int i=0; i<vertical; ++i)
00080    {
00081       cout << "\n";
00082       for (int j=0; j<horizontal; ++j)
00083      cout << form(" %3d", transp==Transposed ? thematrix[j][i] : thematrix[i][j])
00084           << flush;
00085    }
00086    cout << "\n\n" << flush;
00087 }
